channel.title: All - naacl.org
channel.description: All - for the North American Chapter of the Association for Computational Linguistics: NAACL.

item.title: NLP Workshop in Quito, Ecuador
item.description: NAACL is pleased to endorse a Workshop on Natural Language Processing to be held on October 21, 2014, as part of the 5th Information Systems Research Working Days (JISIC 2014), hosted by the Department of Informatics and Computer Science of the National Polytechnic School of Ecuador.

item.title: NA Teams Win Gold at 2014 ILO
item.description: Teams from USA and Canada recently won 10 medals including the team gold at the 2014 International Linguistics Olympiad in Beijing (press release). The teams were selected through the North American Computational Linguistics Olympiad competition, sponsored in part by NAACL. There will also be a Francophone competition for the first time in 2015 (hosted in Canada).

item.title: NAACL 2015 Call for Papers
item.description: The NAACL 2015 Call for Papers is now available. The submission deadline for both long and short papers is December 4, 2014.

item.title: 2014 NAACL Emerging Regions Fund Call for Proposals
item.description:
The goal of the NAACL Emerging Regions fund is to assist the creation of a larger and more cohesive Computational Linguistics community in Latin America, and to enhance more regional interactions among students and researchers anywhere in the Americas. Deadline: 31 August 2014 (midnight PST) for events to take place between September 2014 and September 2015.

Read more »

item.title: Minutes from NAACL 2014 Board Meeting
item.description: Minutes from the 2014 NAACL Board meeting have been posted.

item.title: ACL 2014 Best Paper Award Winners
item.description: ACL 2014 has concluded. Congratulations to the Best Paper Award winners and those receiving honorable mention.

item.title: NAACL 2015 Dates Announced
item.description:
NAACL 2015 dates have been announced: The conference will take place in Denver, Colorado, from May 31 to June 5, 2015 (submission deadline: December 4, 2014).

ACL 2015 will take place in Beijing in August.

item.title: Enabling Writers competition ($100,000 prize)
item.description:
NAACL is pleased to endorse the All Children Reading: A Grand Challenge for Development’s Enabling Writers competition. This global competition seeks to spur the development of software solutions that allow authors to easily create and export texts in mother tongue languages to help early-grade students to read. (Deadline: October 1st, 2014)

For further information, see http://allchildrenreading.org/challenge/.

item.title: Summer Tutorial 2 - The EM Algorithm
item.description: In the lab meeting next week, Jun 4th, We will continue our discussion of the EM algorithm and it’s applications in Natural Language Processing. The meeting will be at TASC1 9408 from 11:00 to 12:00 (please note: New time).

item.title: SLT 2014 Call for Papers
item.description: NAACL is providing technical co-sponsorship for the 2014 IEEE Spoken Language Technology Workshop (SLT 2014), and the Call for Papers is now available! (Deadline: July 21, 2014.)
